intro: Timonius koenigii, commonly known as Indian borage, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. However, it is not as widely cultivated as other members of its family.
